title: Trade: Orgalim recommendations for the CBAM transition period
author: Lorenzo Livraghi
text:
Lorenzo Livraghi 
						
                        
						                             Senior Adviser – Trade and Industrial Policy 
						
                        
                         
                     The Carbon Border Adjustment Mechanism (CBAM), coupled with the phase-out of free allocation under the EU Emissions Trading System (ETS), will have a negative impact on the competitiveness of Europe’s technology industries. Technology manufacturers will face a considerable increase in the cost of key manufacturing inputs such as steel and aluminium. They will have to face competition from third country manufacturers of downstream products that are able to source raw materials at more competitive prices and export to Europe (as well as other markets worldwide) without being subject to CBAM. To read our recommendations in full, please download the document above.
